episodeTitle: Was it Lost? Stolen? Who Are You?
description: A mysterious boy with a seahorse instrument appears at night and steals the crew's memories. Only Robin, who was awake, remembers their adventures. When the crew wakes up, they have no memory of each other, reverting to who they were before joining. Nami flees with treasure while Zoro swims away, as Robin desperately tries to keep everyone together.

events.title: Drim and Noko's First Appearance
events.description: A mysterious young boy named Drim appears in the ocean at night, playing a seahorse-shaped instrument named Noko. The hypnotic music begins to affect the sleeping Straw Hat Pirates.
events.significance: Introduces the antagonists of the Ocean's Dream Arc and sets up the memory theft plot that will span the next several episodes.

events.title: Noko's Memory Stealing Ability Revealed
events.description: Noko uses his hypnotic seahorse music to steal the memories of all sleeping crew members. The mysterious music causes the crew to lose all memories up to the point before they joined the Straw Hat Pirates.
events.significance: First demonstration of Noko's unique memory-stealing power, which forms the central conflict of the Ocean's Dream Arc. This ability affects all crew members except Robin.

events.title: Robin Stays Awake
events.description: Nico Robin is awake reading while the rest of the crew sleeps, making her the only crew member unaffected by Noko's memory-stealing attack. She witnesses the mysterious figure but doesn't understand what's happening.
events.significance: Establishes Robin as the only crew member with intact memories, setting up her role as the one who must try to keep the crew together and restore their memories.

events.title: The Crew Wakes Up With No Memories
events.description: The Straw Hat crew wakes up in the morning completely confused about their surroundings. Luffy, Nami, Zoro, Usopp, Sanji, and Chopper have no memory of the Going Merry, each other, or their adventures together. They've reverted to their pre-crew personalities and memories.
events.significance: The core premise of the Ocean's Dream Arc is established. Each character has reverted to who they were before joining the crew, creating immediate conflict and character exploration opportunities.

quotes.text: Why am I on this ship? Who are all of you?
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami wakes up confused and doesn't recognize anyone on the crew

events.title: Robin Tries to Explain
events.description: Robin attempts to explain to the confused crew that they are all nakama (comrades) on the pirate ship Going Merry, led by Captain Luffy. However, since she joined the crew most recently, she has limited knowledge of everyone's past and struggles to convince them.
events.significance: Highlights Robin's awkward position as the newest crew member trying to convince everyone of their shared history. Her attempts fail because she lacks the deep knowledge of their early adventures together.

quotes.text: You're all part of the Straw Hat Pirates. This is our ship, the Going Merry.
quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin tries to convince the memory-less crew of their true identities

events.title: Nami Reverts to Pirate-Hating Thief
events.description: Nami, having lost all memories of joining the crew and her adventures with them, reverts to her pre-Arlong Park personality. She sees herself as a cat burglar who hates pirates and doesn't trust anyone. She discovers her own logbook but doesn't believe it's real.
events.significance: Shows how much Nami has changed since joining the crew. Her reversion to her distrustful, pirate-hating self demonstrates the growth she experienced through her time with Luffy and the crew.

quotes.text: I'm a thief who steals from pirates. Why would I be working with pirates?
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami rejects the idea that she's part of a pirate crew

events.title: Nami Steals Treasure and Flees
events.description: True to her thief nature and not trusting the situation, Nami steals treasure from the Going Merry and escapes using a waver, heading toward a nearby island. Robin is unable to stop her.
events.significance: Demonstrates Nami's reversion to her lone wolf, thief persona. This creates the first major split in the crew and sets up the search for her in subsequent episodes.

events.title: Zoro Departs by Swimming
events.description: Roronoa Zoro, having reverted to his bounty hunter persona and not recognizing the crew, decides to leave the ship. He simply dives into the ocean and swims away toward a nearby island, following his own path.
events.significance: Shows Zoro's independent nature and his pre-crew mentality of working alone as a bounty hunter. His casual departure demonstrates how the crew's bonds have been severed by the memory loss.

events.title: Remaining Crew Members' Confusion
events.description: Luffy, Usopp, Sanji, and Chopper remain on the ship, confused about their situation. Luffy doesn't understand why he's on a pirate ship, Usopp thinks about his children's gang back home, Sanji is disoriented about leaving Baratie, and Chopper is frightened without knowing who Dr. Kureha or the others are.
events.significance: Establishes the mental state of the remaining crew members, showing how each has reverted to their pre-crew mindset and lost all the growth and bonds they formed.

events.title: Drim Watches From Afar
events.description: The mysterious boy Drim, still under Noko's hypnotic control, watches the chaos on the Going Merry from a nearby hilltop. He observes as the crew splits apart and struggles with their lost memories.
events.significance: Shows that Drim and Noko are actively monitoring the effects of their memory theft, setting up their continued involvement in the arc.

events.title: Robin's Failed Attempt to Keep the Crew Together
events.description: Despite her best efforts, Robin is unable to keep the Straw Hat crew together. With Nami and Zoro already gone and the others confused and distrustful, Robin realizes the difficulty of her situation. She's the only one who remembers their bonds, but she joined too recently to have deep knowledge of everyone's past.
events.significance: Establishes the central conflict of the arc: Robin must find a way to restore everyone's memories and reunite the crew. This also highlights Robin's growth as a crew member and her commitment to the Straw Hats.

quotes.text: Why am I on this ship? Who are all of you?
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami wakes up with no memory of the crew

quotes.text: You're all part of the Straw Hat Pirates. This is our ship, the Going Merry.
quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin tries to convince the memory-less crew

quotes.text: I'm a thief who steals from pirates. Why would I be working with pirates?
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami rejects being part of a pirate crew

themes.description: The episode explores how memories shape identity and relationships. Without their shared experiences, the crew members revert to who they were before joining, showing how much they've grown.
themes.symbolism: The loss of memories represents the fragility of bonds and how shared experiences create our sense of self and community.

themes.description: Robin's struggle to convince the crew of their true relationships highlights the importance of trust and shared history. Without memories of their adventures, the crew has no reason to trust each other.
themes.symbolism: The scattering of the crew represents how quickly trust can dissolve without the foundation of shared experiences.

themes.description: By reverting characters to their pre-crew selves, the episode showcases how much each character has grown. Nami's distrust, Zoro's solitary nature, and others' confusion contrast sharply with their current personalities.
themes.symbolism: The memory loss serves as a window into the past, showing viewers how far the characters have come.

characterSpotlights.role: The only crew member with memories; desperately trying to hold everyone together
characterSpotlights.development: Robin takes on a leadership role and shows her deep commitment to the Straw Hat crew. Despite being the newest member, she fights to keep everyone together, demonstrating her growth from a loner to a devoted nakama.
keyActions: Stays awake and avoids memory loss
Attempts to explain everyone's true identities
Tries unsuccessfully to prevent Nami from leaving
Struggles with the challenge of keeping the crew together
quotes: You're all part of the Straw Hat Pirates. This is our ship, the Going Merry.

characterSpotlights.role: Reverts to her pirate-hating thief persona and flees with treasure
characterSpotlights.development: The episode shows how much Nami has changed since Arlong Park by contrasting her current self with her past. Without her memories, she's distrustful, calculating, and driven purely by greed.
keyActions: Wakes up with no memory of the crew
Discovers her logbook but doesn't trust it
Reverts to her cat burglar, pirate-hating personality
Steals treasure from the Going Merry
Escapes on a waver to a nearby island
quotes: I'm a thief who steals from pirates. Why would I be working with pirates?
Why am I on this ship? Who are all of you?

characterSpotlights.role: Mysterious antagonist who appears with Noko to steal memories
characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a mysterious figure under Noko's control. His true nature and the extent of the seahorse's influence over him remain unclear.
keyActions: Uses the seahorse's music to steal memories
Observes the chaos from a distance

characterSpotlights.role: The true antagonist; a seahorse with memory-stealing abilities
characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a mysterious creature with powerful hypnotic and memory-stealing abilities. His motivations remain unclear in this episode.
keyActions: Uses hypnotic music to put crew to sleep
Steals memories from all sleeping crew members

mangaDifferences.difference: This entire episode is anime-only filler. The Ocean's Dream Arc does not exist in the manga. It is based on a PlayStation video game 'One Piece: Ocean's Dream!'

trivia.fact: This episode marks the beginning of the Ocean's Dream Arc, which is based on the PlayStation game 'One Piece: Ocean's Dream!' released in 2003.
The Ocean's Dream Arc spans only 5 episodes (220-224), making it one of the shorter filler arcs in One Piece.

sources.title: Ocean's Dream Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: This episode aired with a TV rating of 11.2%, ranking 6th in its timeslot.

Robin being the only crew member unaffected because she was awake creates an interesting dynamic, as she was the most recent member to join at this point and has the least knowledge of everyone's individual backstories.
The screenplay was written by Junki Takegami with assistance from Hito Koyama. Munehisa Sakai directed the episode.
Noko's design as a seahorse that can steal memories is unique to this arc and connects thematically to the earlier Millennium Dragon filler arc, as Noko wishes to become a Sennenryu (dragon).
